All Known Implementing Classes:
AddPropertyValueView, BaseBivariateStatisticsView, BufferView, CorrelationView, CreateVariableView, DatabasePollingViewable, ExternallyTimedWindowView, FilterExprView, FirstElementView, FirstLengthWindowView, FirstTimeView, FirstUniqueByPropertyView, GroupByView, IntersectView, KeepAllView, LastElementView, LastPostObserverView, LengthBatchView, LengthBatchViewRStream, LengthWindowView, LengthWindowViewRStream, MergeView, MethodPollingViewable, NamedWindowConsumerView, NamedWindowOnDeleteView, NamedWindowOnExprBaseView, NamedWindowOnSelectView, NamedWindowRootView, NamedWindowTailView, OnSetVariableView, OutputProcessView, OutputProcessViewDirect, OutputProcessViewPolicy, OutputProcessViewSnapshot, PriorEventView, RegressionLinestView, RouteResultView, SizeView, SortWindowView, SubselectAggregatorView, TimeAccumView, TimeAccumViewRStream, TimeBatchView, TimeBatchViewRStream, TimeLengthBatchView, TimeOrderView, TimeWindowView, UnionView, UniqueByPropertyView, UnivariateStatisticsView, UpdateDispatchViewBase, UpdateDispatchViewBlockingSpin, UpdateDispatchViewBlockingWait, UpdateDispatchViewNonBlocking, ViewSupport, WeightedAverageView, ZeroDepthStream
public interface Viewable
extends EventCollection

The Viewable interface marks an object as supporting zero, one or more View instances. All implementing classes must call each view's 'update' method when new data enters it. Implementations must take care to synchronize methods of this interface with other methods such that data flow is threadsafe.
